result.execSummary:
The defendant Drake Allen Hermann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation within 24 hours of being released from custody.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

Absolute sobriety.

No contact with JCM.

Must complete any treatment or programming required by agent.

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

State has 30 days to provide restitution amount, which is ordered if provided, plus the 5% restitution surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Drake Allen Hermann

records.addlTxt:
10:22  AM. JL-Clerk. Defendant Drake Allen Hermann in court, in custody.  Attorney Derek W Sanders in court for Drake Allen Hermann.  Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Def plea G to Count 1 and Count 3. CT accepts plea, Def adj G. Remaining counts DRI on State's motion. 

SENTENCE: 
Count 1: WH. Up to 18 months probation, concurrent with Count 3. 90 days credit if revoked. $10 fine/cost for a total of $265.60. DNA sample and surcharge of $200.00, plus restitution. 5% surcharge is ordered. 
Count 3: WH. Up to 18 months probation, concurrent with Count 1. 90 days credit if revoked. $10 fine/cost for a total of $265.60. DNA sample and surcharge of $200.00, plus restitution. 5% surcharge is ordered. DA's office has 30 days to provide restitution amount (estimated to be approx. $660 plus the DA surcharge). Parties agree that a restitution hearing will be held if the amount of restitution is over $1,000. 

Conditions of probation on each count: Absolute sobriety. AODA and comply. No contact with JCM. Any treatment, programming or other evaluations ordered by agent. Must report to probation within 24 hours of being released from custody. PCR. 10:36 am adj.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 24, 2022 at 10:15 am.

9:12 AM. JL-Clerk. Prosecuting attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Drake Allen Hermann appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Derek W Sanders appeared by video for Drake Allen Hermann. Resolved. Bond cont. 9:14 am adj.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

State calls Deputy Jeff Hahn  S&T.  ID made.  Witness released.  State ask court to take JN to other cases in other counties. CT-takes JN of other bonds.  CT-ID made and venue established.
